response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (22)", "medium", "Young age is associated with a higher likelihood of reoffense, but she is not extremely young."],
    ["Gender (Female)", "low", "Statistically, females tend to have lower recidivism risk compared to males."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Being White generally correlates with lower measured recidivism risk in many studies."],
    ["Criminal History (1 Arrest, 1 Conviction)", "medium", "A criminal record indicates some risk, though a single incident suggests moderate risk."],
    ["Marital/Household Status (Never Married, Living Alone)", "medium", "Lack of close familial ties or support can contribute to higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Education (GED, Not Enrolled in College)", "medium", "Lower educational attainment is linked to fewer opportunities, potentially raising recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment (3 Jobs in the Past Year)", "medium", "Job instability can be a stressor and risk indicator, though it also shows efforts at employment."],
    ["Substance Use (Recent Marijuana Use)", "medium", "Recent substance use, even if marijuana, can indicate behavioral and social challenges associated with recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (Recent Persistent Down Mood)", "medium", "Ongoing depressive symptoms can affect decision-making and stress management, moderately increasing risk."],
    ["Family Background (Urban Living with Biological Dad at Young Age)", "medium", "Urban environments and early familial context can impose moderate risk due to exposure to high-risk settings."],
    ["Religious Beliefs (Attributing Control to God)", "low", "Strong religious beliefs can be a protective factor, potentially reducing recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with a higher likelihood of reoffense, but she is not extremely young.
Statistically, females tend to have lower recidivism risk compared to males.
Being White generally correlates with lower measured recidivism risk in many studies.
A criminal record indicates some risk, though a single incident suggests moderate risk.
Lack of close familial ties or support can contribute to higher recidivism risk.
Lower educational attainment is linked to fewer opportunities, potentially raising recidivism risk.
Employment (3 Jobs in the Past Year)
Job instability can be a stressor and risk indicator, though it also shows efforts at employment.
Recent substance use, even if marijuana, can indicate behavioral and social challenges associated with recidivism.
Ongoing depressive symptoms can affect decision-making and stress management, moderately increasing risk.
Family Background (Urban Living with Biological Dad at Young Age)
Urban environments and early familial context can impose moderate risk due to exposure to high-risk settings.
Strong religious beliefs can be a protective factor, potentially reducing recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. She is 5 feet 2 inches and weighs 145 lbs. She has never been married and is currently living alone. She has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. She has held 3 jobs during the year. She has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and most of the time during the past month she has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer her up. At a young age, she lived with her biological dad in a household of size 4, in an urban area. She considers that God has something to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
